result.execSummary:
The defendant Tammy M. McWilliams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: This sentence is to commence consecutive to 12CF397

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $268 
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge 
--To reimburse buy money of $135

--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random Urinalyses (not less than 1x/mth for the first 12 months)
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 12CF397 & 14CF107 called together at 1:35 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Tammy M. McWilliams in court, in custody, with Attorney John V Rhiel. DA Susan V Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon questioning of the Court, Counsel indicate that they do not have any corrections for the revocation summary in 12CF397

14CF107: Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Ms. McWilliams waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information
; Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
Court finds that enhancer is applicable because Ms. McWilliams is subsequent offender

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
DA Happ reviews for the record that upon speaking with the Walworth County DAs Office, there is agreement that plea in Jefferson County Case 14CF107, Walworth County will not issue charges for alleged delivery on 9/11/13 & 9/12/13 in Walworth County.
Sentencing Arguments by Counsel; Statement by Kevin Miller; Statement by Karen Andro; Statement by Def.; Statement by Dave McWilliams

The Court sentences Ms. McWilliams to 6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 4 years. This sentence is to commence consecutive to 12CF397.

12CF397-Count #1: The Court sentences Ms. McWilliams to 2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year. This sentence is to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being.

BOTH CASES: The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 119 days credit for time already served-12CF397
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served-14CF107

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision TO COVER BOTH CASES:
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random Urinalyses (not less than 1x/mth for the first 12 months)
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--To pay costs of $268 (14CF107)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge (14CF107)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand (14CF107)
--To reimburse buy money of $135 (14CF107)
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

Court orders all remaining costs in 12CF397 due today; failure to pay results in civil judgment

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 2:20 pm
Notice of assignemnt of judge sent to the jail
Waiver of Prelim on June 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
cases #12CF397 and #14CF107 called at 10:47am. 
Defendant Tammy M. McWilliams in court, in custody, with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Case #12CF397 was scheduled for Sentencing After Revocation today, and Case #14CF107 was scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today, however the Court informs the parties that it has come upon information related to Ms. McWilliams and this information causes the Court to feel it needs to recuse. 
The hearings will be rescheduled before the newly assigned judge.
recess 10:49am. 

NEXT:  (1) Application for Judicial Assignment (2) once Judicial Assignment is completed, please schedule Case #12CF397 for Sentencing After Revocation as soon as possible, and schedule case #14CF107 for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing (time limits for Prelim in case #14CF107 have been waived)
Letters in support of the defendant submitted by Attorney Rhiel
from defendant regarding sentence

Response from the Court dated 05-22-2014 already copied to parties//The Court is not permitted to pay any roled in this case and will forward a copy to all parties and the presiding judge as required by law
State's with cover letter
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 7, 2014 at 09:40 am.

case called at 1:05pm. 
Defendant Tammy M. McWilliams appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney John Rhiel.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 

Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
recess 1:07pm. 
[Post-Hearing/Off-Record the clerk realizes that she mis-spoke in announcing the Pretrial Date-- the correct Pretrial date is May 7th at 9:40, not the April 30th at 9:40am announced in court.]

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/7/14 at 9:40am  (2) schedule Preliminary Hearing approximately 2-3 weeks after Pretrial  (Ms. McWilliams remains in the Jefferson County Jail awaiting Sentencing After Revocation)
Attorney John Rhiel
